page.title: 02Verwood Under Development.
page.content: Verwood was identified in the 1977 County Structure Plan as an area suitable for substantial residential development.Since the mid 1970's the population of the village has grown from about 3000 to an estimated 7000 today.It is expected that it will reach 12000 within ten years. There is a schedule of planned development,parcels of land being released for building at set intervals of time. The dwellings vary from 8 to 12 per acre.Most are brick-built.The bricks range from beige or cream,through yellow, orange and red shades to brown or purplish hues.Some bungalows and houses are cement-rendered and painted in pastel colours. Already,the land from Eblake to Pottern Farm and S.W.to Three Legged Cross is built over with new housing.
